Newlyinducted officers of the Association of Residence Hall Students appointed people to two key positions last night in their first acts as ARHS executives PERIOD

Brien Kocher and Melissa Pressler were sworn in as ARHS president and vice president last night PERIOD The executives appointed Kim Tomecsko to be the new director of the Residence Hall Advisory Board PERIOD The motion passed by a  vote in ARHS council PERIOD

 Tomecsko said PERIOD

Kocher also appointed Mark Murphy to the position of executive vice president PERIOD ARHS approved the motion by a  margin PERIOD

Murphy said his roles are to act as a manager and coordinator of ARHS activities PERIOD He also plans to facilitate discussion between ARHSs executives council members and 

Dominic Mattioni and David Shimo stepped down from their ARHS presidential and vice presidential posts last night PERIOD The new executives were elected on March  PERIOD

In other business the Organization for Town Independent Students began nominating candidates for executive posts PERIOD

The sole presidential nominee is Judith Falce PERIOD The vice presidential nominee is Don Savoie PERIOD Mimi Zaldivar is the nominee for the treasurer position PERIOD

Elections for OTIS positions will take place next Monday but candidates may still be nominated that day PERIOD

 by Tim OSullivan
